result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pittaris M Glass

records.addlTxt:
9:50 AM Defendant Pittaris M Glass in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Olsen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is eligible for SPD but has not yet been appointed counsel, requested adjournment. No objection.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 01:40 pm.

1:42 PM Defendant Pittaris M Glass in court.  Prosecuting attorney Robin W Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has applied for SPD, but no one is appointed yet.  Case rescheduled.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on October 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on September 26, 2022 at 01:40 pm.

09:51 AM Defendant appeared.  Trisha L Simmons appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has not yet obtained counsel, requested adjournment and waived time limits. No objection by State. Court granted adjournment.  Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

02:14 PM Defendant in court, in custody via Zoom with Attorney Guy Cardamone.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case to track with 22CF1775.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on July 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:42 AM Defendant appeared.  Valerian Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has not retained counsel.   Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 14  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 14

03:14 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Erin Nagy.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
